Summary Senior Purchasing management professional with experience using MRP and SAP for inventory control. Strengths include, customer orientation, identifying opportunities for efficiency (LEAN Methodology), cost reduction initiatives, lead-time reductions, working with process engineering to proactively maintain accurate stocking levels. Interacts effectively with all levels of management. Works well independently and as a team member. Experience Senior buyer/planner Intel Corporation February 2010  –  August 2015  (5 years 7 months) Hudson, MA. •	Managed repair and logistics for all parts clean kits and repairable parts for sub-fab sort tools. Documented processes and educated the factory stakeholders. 
•	Forecasted and maintained inventory at planned levels to support availability and cost optimization. 
•	Integrated with factory operations by attending daily operations meetings and aligning procurement methods with manufacturing needs. 
•	Reported out inventory health CSI’s (Critical Success Indicators) on a weekly basis. 
•	Optimized spares inventory to support ramping and end of life factory activities over an 18 month period. 
•	Liaised with engineering stakeholders, built, managed and maintained inventory for two new product lines.  
•	Negotiated with suppliers to accelerate or delay delivery to meet production consumption requirements 
•	Obtained NDAs to support new product line. 
 
 Global Commodity Specialist Intel March 2006  –  February 2010  (4 years) Hudson,MA. •	•	With the announcement of Arizona Fab ‘end of life’, worked with the other Intel global factories to redistribute tool and spare parts to their stock rooms. 
•	Developed and maintained excellent communications and relationships with all business partners at eight sites across the US and Ireland. 
•	Team member and content expert of the MRP conversion team 
•	Managed end of life activities for New Mexico Fab with a focus on Sub-fab tools to minimize liability. 
•	Effectively lead and managed 130 suppliers to deliver a solid supply chain for spares and services 
•	International travel that allowed for understanding of foreign cultures and work practices. 
 Transaction Specialist Intel Corp. February 1998  –  March 2006  (8 years 2 months) Hudson MA> •	Supported construction organization by submitting RFQ (Request for Quotation) and converting requisitions into purchase orders 
•	Managed tactical support for procurement operations (Invoice resolution, exception resolution and past due PO’s management) for various commodities (Quartz, Metals, Targets, etc.). 
•	Interfaced with multiple organizations including finance and accounts payable. 
•	Remotely managed from Arizona and Oregon – demonstrated the ability to work independently. 
•	Insured timely three way match requirements to keep all suppliers current and reduce liability. 
•	Received and processed requisitions into purchase orders to support various project teams.
